availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Shackleford, Jr. (Fayette County, KY, Christian minister, curator of Kentucky Univ)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, minister and university curator. Mason County, Kentucky native. Son of John Shackleford, Sr. and Ann Coburn Shackleford. Married to Elizabeth Shackleford. Father of John Shackleford. Student in Mason County in 1850. Family owned four enslaved persons in Maysville in 1850. Minister in Maysville in 1860. Family owned two enslaved persons in Maysville in 1860. Member of the board of curators of Kentucky University in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 47B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 691, p. 3 of microfilm.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 324.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 4B, p. 2 of microfilm.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Decatur County, Washington, p. 215A.
Find A Grave, "John Shackleford (1834-1921)," Memorial #11626563, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11626563 (accessed December 20, 2019).
